Spain: Alfonso the Battler conquered the Almoravid city of Longares.

Alfonso the Emperor and Alfonso the Battler signed the Peace of Támara at Támara de Campos. The treaty recognized Alfonso the Emperor's sovereignty over Castile and reestablished the 1054 border between Castile and Aragon. Alfonso the Battler renounced the title of emperor.
Malta: Norman control over Malta is consolidated under Roger II of Sicily.
A Norman governor is installed, and Norman soldiers are garrisoned in Malta's three main castles.
Christianity re-established as the Islands' dominant religion.
China: Jingkang Incident: The Song capital Kaifeng fell to a Jin siege. Huizong and Qinzong were captured with much of their court.
Huizong's son Emperor Gaozong of Song became emperor of the Song dynasty at Lin'an City.
Belgium: Murder of Charles the Good, Count of Flanders
William Clito claims countship of Flanders
